isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 3.4: ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS, SENSOR AND ACTUATOR DIAGNOSTIC PROCEDURES - SENSOR AND ACTUATOR DIAGNOSTIC PROCEDURES - CONNECTOR CHECKS TO GROUND (B-)

svcproc.title: CONNECTOR CHECKS TO GROUND (B-)
svcproc.para: The next step is to measure the resistance of all wiring harness connectors to ground (preferably the negative battery cable) to determine if a short to ground condition is present. It is important that during this test all accessories including the dome light be turned off, current flow in the system will affect resistance readings. If the reading is fluctuating greatly, disconnect the positive battery cable and measure to the negative battery cable.

step1.para:
Connect positive lead of DVOM to pin (A) and negative lead to battery negative. Signal ground (marked "A" on all engine sensor harness connectors) should measure less than 5 ohms. (Signal ground on vehicle sensor connectors vary) ( Figure 3.10
).
The V Ref and signal lines, with the processor connected, will normally measure greater than 1000 ohms.

step1.para: Power ground on an actuator circuit should measure less than 5 ohms. The control side of an actuator circuit will normally measure greater than 1000 ohms.
